poem:
Title: "Election's Dawn"

Waking to secrets whispered in the bowels of Westminster,
Chaos births in May's maiden bloom, power's showy jester.
Words written on the walls of time, budgets born in haste,
Shadow and sunlight tangle in the government's test.
O, the game of power, the dance of the elected,
Here in the morning light, our futures are reflected.
